section.title: Introduction
section.para: So if you want to start drawing in your GWT applications, this document is for you. You don't have to know anything about &R; library because this User Guide will explaing everithing from the start. Nevertheless, if you do know &R; it will be easier for you to getting started with &RG; because the &J; API is very analogous to &R;'s..
&RG; is a complete java API for the &R; &JS; drawing library. It is designed with the following considerations in mind:

formalpara.title: Complete API
formalpara.para: &RG; supports all &R; features and contains some artificial java types for easy working with advanced &R; features like paths, gradients, animations, etc in &J;

formalpara.title: Straightforward API
formalpara.para: &RG; is designed so the &J; API is very similar to the &JS; API, so &JS; &R; users will feel familiar with the API and do not have top re-learn a new Java API.

formalpara.title: Lightweight - zero overhead.
formalpara.para: &RG; uses GWT Overlay Types intensively, for avoiding overhead while wrapping native objects. Your &RG; java code will be translated to javascript native code that will run with the same efficiency as native &J; &R; code.

formalpara.title: Documentation and examples
formalpara.para: &RG; comes with a nice User guide (this document!) that will introduce the library from the simple cases to the more advanced techniques and tools. Also, there is available a Big example gallery that contain a lot of punctual examples which you can run and see its &J; sources online. Great for learning from examples!

formalpara.title: Updated
formalpara.para: &RG; is based and on latest &R; version (2.1 as this document is being written), and it will be always updated for reflecting last &R; improvements..

formalpara.title: Charts
formalpara.para: &RG; supports the full GRaphael chart library for making charts in &J; as a separate GWT module. See the Chars example gallery for looking at charts example with its &J; sources.

section.para: In this section we will detail the neccesary things to do for being able of drawing with &RG; in your GWT applications.

First of all we need a functional GWT application project in which we want to draw using &RG;. In eclipse, if you have Google's plugins installed, you can create a new GWT application project doing File -> New -> Web Application project.
